Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2011 06:17PM sweet_one wrote: I have a follow-up question. Fibroadenomas aren't supposed to increase BC risk, are they? Since  the ultrasound, my mom has been dxed with BC.
Posts.Title: Only had Ultrasound, very confused!!!! sweet_one marie5890

Posts.Content: sweet_one wrote: Hello all, First a little background:  I am in my twenties and just had my first ultrasound after feeling a lump in my right breast and confirming it with my PCP. A 3 cm mass was found during the test.  It appeared to both the tech and the MD to be B9, however they didn't biopsy it. The radiologist recommend removal based on size. Before I meet with the surgeon, I'd like to be as informed as possible.  My questions:  Would my mass be given a BI-RADS score at this point? Is it prudent to ask for a core biopsy before moving forward? What is the healing process like for a  core biopsy? In someone with small breasts, is excisional biopsy disfiguring?  How much does cryoablation cost?   Thanks so much!  sweet_one Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Only had Ultrasound, very confused!!!! sweet_one marie5890

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2010 12:06PM sweet_one wrote: Thanks, Flash and Fearless! Do radiological reports typically cost the patient?  Additional insight is welcome, as I am still nervous and confused!
